metadata.readme_excerpt:
# ebay-mcp-server-by-cdata
CData's Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server for eBay

:heavy_exclamation_mark: This project builds a local, read-only MCP server. For fully remote MCP access, check out the first managed MCP platform: [CData Connect AI](https://www.cdata.com/ai/). For locally hosted, full read, write, update, delete, and action capabilities and a simplified setup, check out our [CData MCP Server for eBay](https://www.cdata.com/drivers/ebay/download/mcp/).
## Purpose
We created this read-only MCP Server to allow LLMs (like Claude Desktop) to query live data eBay supported by the [CData JDBC Driver for eBay](https://www.cdata.com/drivers/ebay/jdbc/).

CData JDBC Driver connects to eBay by exposing them as relational SQL models.

This server wraps that driver and makes eBay data available through a simple MCP interface, so LLMs can retrieve live information by asking natural language questions â€” no SQL required.

## Setup Guide
1. Clone the repository:
      ```bash
      git clone https://github.com/cdatasoftware/ebay-mcp-server-by-cdata.git
      cd ebay-mcp-server-by-cdata
      ```
2. Build the server:
      ```bash
      mvn clean install
      ``` 
      This creates the JAR file: CDataMCP-jar-with-dependencies.jar
2. Download and install the CData JDBC Driver for {source}: [https://www.cdata.com/drivers/ebay/download/jdbc](https://www.cdata.com/drivers/ebay/download/jdbc/)
3. License the CData JDBC Driver:
